thread.title: TCU fan sets up crowdfunding page to help young Iowa State fan from viral photo
thread.title_full: TCU fan sets up crowdfunding page to help young Iowa State fan from viral photo | Dallas Morning News

author: Jose Rodriguez
title: TCU fan sets up crowdfunding page to help young Iowa State fan from viral photo
text:
You've likely seen the photo by now -- the one of TCU quarterback Trevone Boykin engaging 7-year-old Abby Faber before kickoff of Saturday's game at Iowa State.
According to the Fort Worth Star-Telegram , Faber was chosen to be a "Kid Captain" for the game from Blank Children's Hospital in Des Moines, Iowa. She has cerebral palsy. The two met near midfield before the coin toss.
And the image went viral. Boykin had this to share about the moment via Instagram:
It's bigger than a game I love touching young people lives ðŸ™ðŸ½ðŸ¸ #GodIsBigEnough
A photo posted by Trevone Boykin (@t2boykin) on Oct 18, 2015 at 11:37am PDT
It's become bigger than perhaps even he could've imagined.
A TCU fan -- or fans, it may seem -- worked with Faber's family to set up a crowdfunding page to help with her physical therapy and other needs that are not covered by insurance. The following can be read on the page: "A picture was captured of Trevone Boykin taking time to meet Abby and TCU fans were touched and reached out wanting to know how they could help Abby and her family."
Without a doubt!! So proud of the ðŸ¸ nation .. Abby Faber has touched us all https://t.co/XHxOhgBZK3
— Chris Del Conte (@_delconte) October 22, 2015
@_delconte TCU fans set up a donation page for Abby Faber from ISU. That's what Horned Frog nation is all about! https://t.co/lt0c24IfBt
— traderfrog (@TraderFrog) October 22, 2015 More than $3,000 had been raised by early Thursday morning.
Click here to visit the page.
